title: Watch live: Crew-12 launch and docking
summary: Join ESA teams to watch live the launch and docking of Crew-12, marking the beginning of a nine‑month mission to the International Space Station.

title: Winter Grips Japan
summary: The country’s northern regions are accustomed to snow, but unrelenting storms have snarled transportation and caused other challenges this winter.

title: Musk says SpaceX focus is on the moon rather than Mars
summary:
A little more than a year after dismissing the moon as a “distraction,” Elon Musk says SpaceX will focus on lunar settlement before sending humans to Mars.
The post Musk says SpaceX focus is on the moon rather than Mars appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Launch Preview: Vulcan to launch USSF-87, SpaceX to launch Crew-12 to ISS
summary:
The launch manifest is full this week, with eight launches scheduled from different launch sites…

title: What You Need to Know About NASA’s SpaceX Crew-12 Mission
summary: Four crew members are set to launch to the International Space Station as part of NASA’s SpaceX Crew-12 mission, where they will conduct research, technology demonstrations, and maintenance aboard the orbiting laboratory. The crew will lift off from Space Launch Complex 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida aboard a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft […]

title: Weather delays NASA’s SpaceX Crew-12 flight to the International Space Station
summary: The launch is now targeting no earlier than Thursday, Feb. 12, but that too could face challenges from a weather standpoint.

title: Crew-12 to Return ISS to Normal Complement
summary: The crew of NASA’s Crew-12 mission arrived at Kennedy Space Center on February 6th, ahead of their planned launch to the International Space Station on Thursday, February 12th.

title: Space Station Research Contributes to Artemis II
summary: Have you ever heard the saying, “You have to learn how to walk before you can run?” The same can be true in human space exploration. To push capabilities further and ensure safe, successful missions, NASA must test ideas and solve challenges ahead of time. While Earth-based research and engineering helps NASA progress through various […]

title: Icy Hudson River
summary: During a stretch of frigid weather in late January 2026, ice choked the Hudson River along Manhattan’s western shore. The OLI (Operational Land Imager) on Landsat 8 captured this image of the wintry landscape around midday on Jan. 28. This image uses representational color to distinguish ice (light blue) from open water and snow. Vegetation appears red. Much of […]

title: Has Elon Musk given up on Mars?
summary: "SpaceX has already shifted focus to building a self-growing city on the Moon."
